Package CS18000_Project04_Summer2019

Class CommonFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • CS18000_Project04_Summer2019.CommonFile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AudioFile, ImageFile, TextFile, UnknownFile, VideoFile
    abstract class CommonFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Project 04 - File Manipulator

    This is the abstract class called CommonFile. CommonFile defines basic concepts for a file, including whether a file can be opened, whether a file can be played, and returning the file extensions. As it is an abstract class, many different classes are derived from this class, and override methods in this class, or create method bodys for the methods that include the abstract modifier in the method signature.

    Version:
    1.0 (5/26/2019)
    Author:
    Kedar Abhyankar

      • openable

        public boolean openable()
        This method should return whether the File can be opened.
        Returns:
        true if the file can be opened, else false.

      • playable

        public boolean playable()
        This method should return whether the File can be played.
        Returns:
        true if the file can be played, else false.

      • opensWith

        public java.lang.String opensWith()
        This method should return the name of the program used to open that file, based on its File Type.
        Returns:

      • setCanOpen

        void setCanOpen​(boolean open)
        This method should allow the user to change the property of whether the file can be opened or not.
        Parameters:
        open - boolean state that the variable representing whether the file can be opened or not will become.

      • setCanPlay

        void setCanPlay​(boolean play)
        This method should allow the user to change the property of whether the file can be played or not.
        Parameters:
        play - boolean state that the variable representing whether the file can be played or not will become.

      • setProgramToOpenIn

        void setProgramToOpenIn​(java.lang.String program)
        This method should allow the user to change the property of what program the file opens with.
        Parameters:
        program - String which represents the name of the program the file will open with.

      • extension

        java.lang.String extension()
        This method gives the user the extension of the file.
        Returns:
        returns the extension of the file, or everything following the first '.' in the file.

        Returns:
